metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10065 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The ReadVIFFImage function in coders/viff.c in ImageMagick before 7.0.1-0allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) orhave other unspecified impact via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.3').
